text: Is there a way to conveniently define a C-like structure in Python?
I'm tired of writing stuff like:

code:
class MyStruct():
    def __init__(self, field1, field2, field3)
        self.field1 = field1
        self.field2 = field2
        self.field3 = field3

text: (Interesting, it appears I can't type underscores following non-whitespace in pre-formatted text blocks)
